text.p: Transport Minister Vilis Krishtopans is considering resigning, the transport ministry said, amid a growing corruption row linked to ministers who have posts as company directors as well as their ministerial jobs.
Under anti-corruption laws, ministers and members of parliament (MPs) are not allowed to combine their official work with employment in the private sector.
The transport ministry said in a statement that Krishtopans was considering resigning even if the results of investigations into the anti-corruption scandal do not compromise him.
Krishtopans is among a number of ministers and MPs who have been named as holding directors' posts according to lists in the hands of the state company register.
The job of Economics Minister Guntar Krasts is also under threat due to the same reasons.
The transport ministry said that Prime Minister Andris Shkele has been informed that Krishtopans was considering resigning.
